c74object.name: fl.samplerate~
c74object.digest: Convert or output values based on the sample rate.
c74object.description: For output modes the output is a single value. For conversion modes the size matches the input size. The sample rate or the nyquist frequency can be requested. Alternatively, a number of sample rate related conversions are offered.

entry.name: /mode [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the type of conversion or value to output:
rate - output the sample rate in Hz.
nyquist - output the nyquist frequency in Hz.
samples-ms - convert from samples to milliseconds.
samples-seconds - convert from samples to seconds.
ms-samples - convert from milliseconds to samples.
seconds-samples - convert from seconds to samples.
normalised-hz - convert from normalised frequency to frequency in Hz.
h-normalised - convert from frequency in Hz to normalised frequency.
[0] - rate [1] - nyquist [2] - samples->ms [3] - samples->seconds [4] - ms->samples [5] - seconds->samples [6] - normalised->hz [7] - hz->normalised

entry.name: /normalisation [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the reference point for normalised frequency:
rate - [0 - 1] is equivalent to [0 - sample rate].
nyquist - [0 - 1] is equivalent to [0 - nyquist].
[0] - full [1] - nyquist

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.samplerate~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else, a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.samplerate~. When set to 0 fl.samplerate~ can form part of a non-realtime network for processing in message threads, using buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.samplerate~.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
